title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A wind turbine blade detached in Plymouth, Massachusetts, landing in a cranberry bog near Head of the Bay Road.
The turbine, located in a remote area, automatically shut down in fail-safe mode, preventing public danger.
The maintenance company and officials are investigating; no injuries were reported, and the area was secured.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' is now streaming on Disney+, continuing Marvel's superhero saga.
'Frankenstein' by Guillermo del Toro, a unique adaptation of Mary Shelley's novel, is streaming on Netflix.
'Materialists', a romcom starring Dakota Johnson and Pedro Pascal, is available on HBO Max.

title: Stefon Diggs reveals what heâ€™s trying to improve about himself after 11 years in the NFL
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Stefon Diggs leads Patriots with 508 receiving yards, contributing significantly to their six-game win streak this season.
Diggs aims to improve his attitude, acknowledging a perfectionist drive fueled by his competitive edge.
Diggs praises coaches Josh McDaniels and Todd Downing for creating a supportive and balanced team environment.

title: Commuter train plows through car on tracks in Acton
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: An MBTA commuter rail train hit an empty car at a railway crossing in Acton on Thursday evening.
The car's driver exited after reportedly bypassing closed crossing gates, avoiding injury.
The collision caused delays on the Fitchburg line, terminating Train 1427 at South Acton.

title: What to know about possible Red Sox free agent target Munetaka Murakami after posting
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Munetaka Murakami, dubbed the 'Japanese Babe Ruth', was posted by the Tokyo Yakult Swallows for MLB free agency.
Murakami, 25, is viewed as a top free-agent hitter, with potential interest from the Boston Red Sox.
MLB teams signing Murakami will pay a posting fee, potentially adding up to $16.9 million or more.

title: Airlines are waiving fees, offering refunds due to reduced flight schedules
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: The FAA reduced flights by 10% at 40 airports, including Logan, due to a government shutdown.
Airlines like JetBlue and Southwest are waiving fees and offering full refunds for affected travelers.
Customers are advised to check with their airlines for delays, cancellations, and rebooking policies.

title: After Cape Cod crash, readers say Mass. should tighten e-bike regulations
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: A crash on the Cape Cod Rail Trail has sparked calls for stricter e-bike regulations in Massachusetts.
Nearly 78% of over 580 readers support tougher e-bike laws, citing increased accidents and safety concerns on trails.
Massachusetts currently classifies e-bikes into two classes; calls for additional rules include licensing and training requirements.

title: Watch: Dog rescued from Ted Williams Tunnel
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts State Police rescued a dog in the Ted Williams Tunnel on Thursday morning.
The dog, spotted near East Boston, initially evaded capture before hopping into a police cruiser.
MassDOT surveillance showed the dog trotting toward vehicles before a trooper stopped traffic to rescue it.

title: Canterbury Farm, ‘a treasure to the Berkshires,’ closes after 40 years
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Canterbury Farm in Becket, Massachusetts, has closed after 40 years, as owners Linda and Dave Bacon retire.
The 200-acre property features 22 kilometers of trails used for cross-country skiing, hiking, and biking.
Changing weather conditions and competition from Airbnb impacted business, contributing to the Bacons' decision to retire.

title: Patriots will be without three key players for matchup vs. Buccaneers
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Patriots players Rhamondre Stevenson, Kayshon Boutte, and Christian Elliss will miss Sunday's game against Buccaneers due to injuries.
Stevenson, injured with a toe issue, missed last week's win; TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings successfully filled the running back role.
Elliss has 53 tackles this season, second on the team, while Boutte leads with five receiving touchdowns and 431 yards.
